items.title: Can He Fix ‘Palace of Scaffolding’ in Time for Belgium’s 200th Birthday?
items.abstract: For an architect trying to renovate his beloved but crumbling Palace of Justice in Brussels, once the largest building in the world, the design challenges pale compared with the political ones.

items.title: Desert Monoliths Reveal World’s Oldest Architectural Plans
items.abstract: Engravings found in Jordan and Saudi Arabia appeared to match nearby ancient megastructures known as desert kites as seen from above.

items.title: How A.I. Is Helping Architects Change Workplace Design
items.abstract: With more hybrid workers and new office needs, firms like Zaha Hadid Architects are turning to artificial intelligence for solutions.

items.title: Istanbul Modern Reopens in its New, Renzo Piano-Designed Home
items.abstract: After five years of construction, the modern and contemporary art museum welcomes visitors in its new space along the banks of the Bosporus.

items.title: New York City Sues Queens Library Architects Over Lack of Accessibility
items.abstract: City officials argued that the building was not compliant with the Americans With Disabilities Act and other laws.
